While "Maleficent" is a fascinating modern retelling, if you're looking for a film from 1929, I'd recommend delving into the mystery of "White Night." This intriguing film revolves around an unsolved murder case that haunts a lead investigator for years. Starring an ensemble cast, it promises to keep you guessing till the end!

If you're open to films from different eras, Hitch is another captivating choice. This film explores the meeting between legendary director Alfred Hitchcock and François Truffaut, a young leader of the Nouvelle Vague, discussing their shared love for cinema history.

In "Thank You for Smoking", you'll follow Nick Naylor, Big Tobacco's chief spokesman, as he navigates the world of corporate spin while trying to be a good father. On the other hand, "This Is Spinal Tap" chronicles the hilarious misadventures of one of England's loudest bands on tour. Both movies should provide an enjoyable and thought-provoking watch!

Both "Scream 3" and "What Women Want" are excellent choices if you're looking for a good laugh and a bit of parody!

In "Scream 3", Sidney Prescott returns to the Hollywood set of a movie based on her life, only to find herself pursued by another Ghostface killer. The movie features an ensemble cast including Neve Campbell, Courteney Cox, and David Arquette.

"What Women Want" stars Mel Gibson as a chauvinistic executive who gains the ability to hear women's thoughts, leading to unexpected comedic situations. Helen Hunt, Marisa Tomei, and Bette Midler also star in this film.

Given your interest in war films and the theme of screaming, I'd highly recommend watching "Schindler's List." This powerful film directed by Steven Spielberg tells the story of Oskar Schindler, a German businessman who saved over a thousand Jewish lives during the Holocaust. The performances by Liam Neeson and Ralph Fiennes are truly captivating.

If you're looking for something a bit different but still fitting your preferences, "Casablanca" is another great choice. This classic film set during World War II follows Humphrey Bogart as he grapples with moral dilemmas while running a nightclub in Morocco. The dramatic plot and iconic performances make it a must-see. Enjoy the movies!

Alternatively, if you're looking for a more action-packed war movie, you might enjoy "Inglourious Basterds". Directed by Quentin Tarantino, it tells the story of Jewish U.S. soldiers planning to assassinate Nazi leaders, intertwined with a theatre owner's personal vengeance. Stars like Brad Pitt and Christoph Waltz contribute to its engaging narrative. Enjoy your movie time!
